arm_group.arm_group_label: contrast ultrasound for patients with AAA
contrast ultrasound for patients without arterial disease

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal is to non-invasively study the metabolic processes within the aortic wall that are
      thought to explain progression to clinical manifestations of an aortic aneurysm.

      Hypothesis is that the non-invasive imaging of Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) with contrast
      ultrasound, coupled with serum biomarker measurements will allow the identification of the
      vulnerable aortic wall and patients who are at risk of AAA growth or rupture.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Predictors of Aortic Aneurysm Growth and Rupture

detailed_description.textblock:
Aim#1: Prospective Contrast Ultrasound (CUS) imaging of patients with AAA to predict AAA
      growth and test gender differences in rate of growth and rupture.

      Aim#2: Serum biomarker testing of patient with AAA. CUS findings will be correlated with
      serum biomarkers and AAA wall histology.

      Prospective Contrast Ultrasound imaging of patients with AAA as part of a pilot feasibility
      study to predict AAA growth and test gender differences in rate of growth and rupture.  CUS
      findings will be correlated with serum biomarkers and AAA wall histology.  Potential
      significance:  This study will evaluate the AAA wall and will be based on detecting areas of
      increased vasa vasorum density within the aneurysm wall and intraluminal thrombus, which
      indicate regional ischemia and inflammation of the aortic wall and propensity for weakening,
      enlargement or rupture.  This novel evaluation of the aortic wall in patients with AAA will
      allow individualized treatment based on the biological potential for growth and rupture.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of AAA with confirmation of diagnosis of any size aneurysm with imaging.

          -  21 years of age or older

          -  ability to give informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Inability to provide an informed consent

          -  Known allergy to Definity

          -  Unstable cardiopulmonary conditions

          -  pregnancy

arm_group_label: contrast ultrasound for patients with AAA
contrast ultrasound for patients without arterial disease

facility.name: University of Pittsburgh Medical Center, Division of Vascular Surgery

clinical_study.official_title: Aortic Wall Behavior as a Predictor of Aortic Aneurysm Growth and Rupture

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Prospective contrast ultrasound will be performed at regular clinically indicated timepoints.
primary_outcome.measure: Time to Growth and/or Rupture of abdominal aortic aneurysm.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years or time of aneurysm repair surgery.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Serum markers will be drawn at each follow up visit until if/when AAA is repaired.  They will also be measured 1 year after repair.
secondary_outcome.measure: Systemic serum biomarkers of AAA will be measured.  These markers are circulating levels of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor, C Reactive Protein, cytokines and osteoprotegerin.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of contrast ultrasound

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
